original: @309b de nas 'jam dpal gzhol nur gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir skya rengs shar ba'i dus kyi tshe rang gi gnas nas byung ste /

analyzed: de dag thams cad dang / gzhan yang nyan thos chen po rnams rang rang gi gnas nas byung ste /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gi chab sgor mchis so //

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: bdag gis de ltar bltas na ci yang mthong ba ma @311b mchis so //
translated: when I look in this way, I do not see anything at all.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /

original: gang gi slad du 'di bdag gi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bdag gi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Because this is the element of self, therefore it is the element of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi slad du 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Because this is the element of the perfection of wisdom, therefore it is the element of the inconceivable.

original: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Since this is the inconceivable realm, it is the realm of non-establishment.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: That which is non-establishment does not exist.

original: gang mchis pa ma lags pa de ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mchis pa ma lags pa de ni 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not exist does not perish.

original: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: That which does not perish is inconceivable.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so //
translated: Thus, the realm of the Tathāgata and the realm of the self are not two, nor are they divided.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom mo zhes bka' stsal pa de yang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom mo zhes bka' stsal pa de yang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Blessed One, when you said, “The cultivation of the self is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom,” why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni bdag gi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni bdag gi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is a term for the realm of the self.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang gis bdag gi dbyings 'tshal pa des chags pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings 'tshal to //
analyzed: gang gis bdag gi dbyings 'tshal pa des chags pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings 'tshal to //
translated: one who knows the realm of the self knows the realm of non-attachment.

original: gang gis chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma @333a *//
analyzed: gang gis chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma @333a *//
translated: One who knows non-attachment does not know any dharma at all.

original: mchis te / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: mchis te / de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags te /
translated: Thus, inconceivable wisdom is the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: chos gang la yang shes pa ma mchis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang shes pa ma mchis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The absence of knowledge of any dharma is the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ye shes de ni don dam par na mchis pa ma lags te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni don dam par na mchis pa ma lags te /
translated: That wisdom does not exist ultimately.

original: gang don dam par ma mchis pa de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang don dam par ma mchis pa de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de don dam par ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'o //

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //🔽gang gi tshe ye shes de dngos po ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o // gang gi tshe ye shes de dngos po ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o //
translated: When that wisdom is unattached, then that wisdom is non-existent.🔽When that wisdom is non-existent, then that wisdom is objectless.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de yul ma mchis pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de yul ma mchis pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that wisdom is objectless,

original: ye shes de ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: then that wisdom is non-abiding.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de mi gnas pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de mi gnas pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: When that wisdom is non-abiding, then that wisdom is unsupported.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de brten pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de brten pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o //
translated: When that wisdom is unsupported, then that wisdom is unproduced.

original: ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'o //
translated: It is unattained.

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It does not arise.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽That wisdom is not compounded by qualities

original: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa yang ma lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa yang ma lags pa'i slad du'o //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: It is because that wisdom is inconceivable.

original: de'i slad du yon tan nam yon tan ma lags par yang ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: de'i slad du yon tan nam yon tan ma lags par yang ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
translated: Therefore, how can it be taught as a quality or not a quality?

original: @333b gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam du ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: @333b gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam du ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Because that wisdom is inconceivable, that wisdom is inconceivable.

original: gang de ltar shes pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du /
analyzed: gang de ltar shes pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du /
translated: One who knows it in that way,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags so //🔽ye shes de ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags so // ye shes de ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /

analyzed: mkhyen pa ma mchis so // ye shes de ni sngon gyi mtha' 'am /

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: That wisdom does not exist from the past or future.

original: ye shes de ni sngon skyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon skyes pa'ang ma lags /

analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa'ang ma lags te / sngon ma skyes pa'i slad du gang ma skyes pa de ni nub par yang mi 'gyur /

original: chad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chad par yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gang yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gang yang ma mchis te /
translated: There is no wisdom whatsoever that is like that wisdom.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing /
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is inconceivable.

original: 'dra ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: It is without compare.

original: ye shes de ni thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma mi dmigs pa ste; de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //🔽ye shes de la mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes de ni thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma mi dmigs pa ste; de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o // ye shes de la mnyam pa'am /
translated: That wisdom is not observed to have a beginning, middle, or end. Therefore, that wisdom is like space.

original: mi mnyam pa mi dmigs ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa mi dmigs ste /
translated: That wisdom is not observed to be equal or unequal.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is equal to the equal.

original: ye shes de ni de 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni de 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
translated: That wisdom is not observed to be another kind of wisdom.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is without compare.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

analyzed: 'jam dpal / ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam /

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes 'di ni ma bgyis pa ste / de'i slad du 'di mi @334a *//
translated: “Blessed One, this wisdom is uncreated.

original: bsgyur ba lags so //
analyzed: bsgyur ba lags so //
translated: Therefore, it is unchanging.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / kar sha pa na rtags ma btab pa ni bsgyur ba yang ma lags /

analyzed: mi bsgyur ba yang ma lags pa'i grangs su mchi'o //
translated: nor is it counted as a coin that is not to be exchanged.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa /
translated: in the same way, this wisdom is not made,

original: ma bsgrubs pa /🔽ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa / ma bskyed pa /
translated: not accomplished,🔽not produced,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: not arisen,

original: ma 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'gag pa ste /
translated: and not ceased.

original: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba lags so //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba lags so //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be exchanged.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,🔽“Mañjuśrī, who has faith in this teaching of the Tathāgata’s wisdom?”

analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa 'di la 'di ltar bstan par su dag mos; 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags /
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags /

translated: they are not free from desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?

original: mi bas pa ni bas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bas pa ni bas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the imperishable is not perishable.

original: yongs su bas par yang mi mchi'o //
analyzed: yongs su bas par yang mi mchi'o //
translated: It is not completely perishable.

original: gang dag 'khor ba las ma 'das la /
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba las ma 'das la /
translated: Those who do not transcend saṃsāra🔽but are not counted among those in saṃsāra,

analyzed: 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi ba dang / gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing /

analyzed: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi bskyed pa de dag gis bstan pa 'di'i don 'tshal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur @334b pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal te //
translated: ” The Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: legs so // khyod kyis tshig 'di legs par smras pa'o //
analyzed: legs so // khyod kyis tshig 'di legs par smras pa'o //
translated: Excellent! You have spoken these words well.

analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then at that time the venerable Mahākāśyapa said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ma mchis pa'i dus na /
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i dus na /
translated: in the future

original: gang la la chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun 'tshal ba dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'byung ba mchis sam /

translated: will there be any who listen to this profound Dharma-Vinaya, have conviction in this profound perfection of wisdom, understand it, and uphold it?”

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa:

analyzed: dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag yod do //

analyzed: dper na / khyim bdag gam /

analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu zhig nor bu rin po che brgya stong ri ba stor na /

translated: If he were to find it again, he would be happy and joyful and would not have any thoughts of being bound up.

translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, those bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās will be miserable and unhappy when they have lost this deep perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, unarisen, essentially empty, essentially peaceful, and essentially absent.🔽They will be happy and joyful when they have found it, and they will not have any thoughts of being bound up.

original: dngos po med pa'i bar du ma thos pa na 'di snyam du bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung pa dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nas /

translated: When they do not hear about the absence of entities, they think, ‘We have not heard this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn,

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bar 'di lta bu 'di ma thos so snyam du sems so //
translated: unoriginated, and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa, up to the absence of entities.’

analyzed: de bdag gis dus gzhan na thos par gyur pa na dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / yid dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When they hear it at another time, they will be happy, joyful, and delighted.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: They will not have the mental activity of being entangled.🔽They will say, ‘In this way, we have heard this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn,

original: tshig 'di skad du 'di ltar bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba 'di thos pas deng bdag cag gis sangs rgyas mthong zhing /
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du 'di ltar bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba 'di thos pas deng bdag cag gis sangs rgyas mthong zhing /
translated: unoriginated, and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa, up to the absence of entities. Today we have seen the Buddha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur yang byas so zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur yang byas so zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and we have also served the Tathāgata.’

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni shing yongs 'du sa brtol kha 'bus pa mthong nas /
analyzed: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni shing yongs 'du sa brtol kha 'bus pa mthong nas /
translated: For example, when the gods of the Thirty-Three see the coral tree and the pārijāta tree blossoming,

original: kye ma yongs 'du sa brtol 'di ring po mi thogs par me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro snyam ste yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kye ma yongs 'du sa brtol 'di ring po mi thogs par me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro snyam ste yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they think, “Oh! Before long, all the flowers of the coral tree and the pārijāta tree will blossom,” and they become happy and joyful.

original: 'od srung de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos na yid dga' ba dang /🔽rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srung de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos na yid dga' ba dang /🔽rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, when those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen hear this profound perfection of wisdom, from ‘unborn’ and ‘unproduced’ up to ‘non-entity,’ they become happy and joyful.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @335b phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srung khyod kyis shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @335b phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srung khyod kyis shes par gyis shig /
translated: Kāśyapa, you should know that those who, in the future, will be delighted and overjoyed when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, unarisen, and so forth up to non-existent, will be present in my very retinue.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba des ring po mi thogs par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba des ring po mi thogs par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas par 'gyur bas /
translated: Those who, in the future, will be delighted and overjoyed, by that delight and joy they will, before long, fully blossom with the flowers of all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur bar shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur bar shes par gyis shig /
translated: You should know that they will fully blossom with all the flowers.

original: 'od srung / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, unarisen,

original: dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyi nas gnas par 'gyur ba dang / spyod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyi nas gnas par 'gyur ba dang / spyod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang /
translated: This non-entity, up to and including the non-existence of entities, will be the abode of the Tathāgata after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa, and it will be the conduct.

original: 'od srung / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, you should know that this is the blessing of the Buddha and the power of the Buddha.

original: 'od srung / de bas na gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dga' na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bas na gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dga' na /
translated: Kāśyapa, therefore, those who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, from its non-production up to its non-existence as an entity, rejoice in it,

original: 'od srung / de ni de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od srung / de ni de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is not their first time hearing it.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong nas /
analyzed: dper na / nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong nas /
translated: for example, a jeweler sees a precious jewel,

original: gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur pa de na nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po che de gdod mthong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur pa de na nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po che de gdod mthong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: and when he rejoices in it, that jeweler is not seeing that precious jewel for the first time.

original: de ni sngon nas rgyun du nor bu rin po che mthong ba'o zhes shes par bya'o //🔽'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol @336a *//
analyzed: de ni sngon nas rgyun du nor bu rin po che mthong ba'o zhes shes par bya'o // 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol @336a *//
translated: You should know that they have seen the precious gem before.

original: tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur cing /
analyzed: tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur cing /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, those who, when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, from its unborn nature up to its non-entityness, are delighted,🔽and experience joy,

original: mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes na /
analyzed: mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes na /
translated: happiness, and mental well-being,

original: 'od srung / 'di ni de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ni de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is not their first time hearing it.

original: 'od srung / de dag ni 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'od srung / de dag ni 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, they will say,

original: gang 'di 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ma skyes pa nas dngos po med pa nas ma byung ba'i bar du bstan pa 'di nyid smros shig ces zer bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'di 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ma skyes pa nas dngos po med pa nas ma byung ba'i bar du bstan pa 'di nyid smros shig ces zer bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‘Speak about this teaching of the youthful Mañjuśrī, from its unborn nature up to its non-entityness.’

original: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o //
translated: They have previously served the youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: mi la la zhig grong ngam /
analyzed: mi la la zhig grong ngam /
translated: Suppose someone has gone to a village,🔽a town,

original: grong khyer ram /🔽grong rdal lam /
analyzed: grong khyer ram / grong rdal lam /
translated: a city,

original: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la'i phyir son par gyur la /
analyzed: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la'i phyir son par gyur la /
translated: or a market for some purpose.

original: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
analyzed: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
translated: Then, at another time, someone comes to them

original: grong khyer de'i bsngags pa brjod cing /
analyzed: grong khyer de'i bsngags pa brjod cing /
translated: and praises that city,

original: kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba de dag gi bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba de dag gi bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: saying, ‘The pleasure grove is delightful, the country is delightful, the ponds are delightful, the parks are delightful, the springs, lakes, and ponds are delightful, the flowers and fruits are delightful.’

original: des de dag thos pa dang dga' ba tshor te /
analyzed: des de dag thos pa dang dga' ba tshor te /
translated: Having heard that, they feel happy,

original: yid bde ba skyes nas yang dang yang 'di skad du kye skyes bu de nyid zlos te /
analyzed: yid bde ba skyes nas yang dang yang 'di skad du kye skyes bu de nyid zlos te /
translated: and with a joyful mind they repeatedly say, ‘Hey, man, say that again!

original: rjod cig ces 'tshol na /
analyzed: rjod cig ces 'tshol na /
translated: Say that again!’

original: mi des ni sngon yang grong khyer de dang / kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams @336b dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
analyzed: mi des ni sngon yang grong khyer de dang / kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams @336b dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
translated: That person will understand that in the past they have experienced that city, that delightful pleasure grove, that delightful country, that delightful pond, that delightful park, that delightful spring, lake, or pond,

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba dag kyang myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba dag kyang myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that delightful flower and fruit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because when they hear that, they will be very pleased and delighted.

original: mgu pa dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgu pa dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They will be satisfied, happy, and joyful.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa dang / yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing 'dri bar byas par gyur pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa dang / yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing 'dri bar byas par gyur pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, those who have served Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, and who have gone to him again and again to ask questions, when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn,

original: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar 'gyur te /
translated: unoriginated, and so forth up to non-entity, will be very joyful and delighted.

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher bskyed cing tshig 'di skad du ma la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher bskyed cing tshig 'di skad du ma la 'di lta ste /
translated: They will greatly increase their joy and delight and say these words:

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu 'di nyid je mnyan to zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu 'di nyid je mnyan to zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘We have heard this very perfection of wisdom, which is taught as unborn, unoriginated, and so forth up to non-entity.’

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Mahākāśyapa said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Blessed One,

original: ma mchis pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam /
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam /
translated: When they do not exist, are the aspects, signs, and indications of those faithful sons and daughters of good family the same as those taught by the Blessed One?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'od srung / ji skad @337a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'od srung / ji skad @337a *//
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bstan pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: bstan pa de bzhin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is just as you have said.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba 'di dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ni gang dag ngas da ltar bstan pa 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba 'di dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ni gang dag ngas da ltar bstan pa 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: In the future, the aspects, signs, and indications of those faithful sons and daughters of good family who will appear are precisely those that I have taught now.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing rtags ma mchis pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing rtags ma mchis pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: that Dharma is without aspects, without signs, and without indications.🔽Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa ma mchis pa nas mtshan ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa ma mchis pa nas mtshan ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is also without aspects up to without indications.

original: rnam pa'am / rtags sam /
analyzed: rnam pa'am / rtags sam /
translated: the aspect,🔽the sign,🔽

original: mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig mchis par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig mchis par 'gyur /
translated: What will be its form, or its signs, or its indications?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
translated: The teachings of the Blessed One are also without form,

original: rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis /
translated: without signs,

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
translated: and without indications.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa ji ltar bstan par 'gyur /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa ji ltar bstan par 'gyur / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Blessed One, how can something that is without form, without signs, and without indications be taught?

original: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan pa na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan pa na /
translated: When Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta had said this, the Blessed One said to him, “Mañjuśrī, when this profound perfection of wisdom, which is utterly unborn and up to which is non-entity, is taught,

original: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa de dag nyid rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa de dag nyid rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yin no //
translated: those who aspire to it and so on, up to those who fully understand it, are themselves the form, the signs, and the indications of those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage.”🔽“Blessed One, how should one aspire to the perfection of wisdom?”

original: 'jam dpal / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @337b pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par lta'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @337b pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par lta'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, wherever the perfection of wisdom is taught, there the teachings of all the buddhadharmas are seen.

original: der bsam gyis mi khyab par blta'o //
analyzed: der bsam gyis mi khyab par blta'o //
translated: There the inconceivable is seen.

original: 'jam dpal / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par bsgrubs te /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par bsgrubs par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par bsgrubs te / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par bsgrubs par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol
translated: Mañjuśrī, when I previously practiced bodhisattva conduct, I accomplished roots of virtue.

original: tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya /
analyzed: tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya /
translated: Those roots of virtue by which I fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, those roots of virtue that I accomplished, a son of good family or daughter of good family who wishes to accomplish should listen to just this perfection of wisdom.

original: mos par bya /
analyzed: mos par bya /
translated: They should believe it.

original: yi ger bri bar bya /
analyzed: yi ger bri bar bya /
translated: They should write it out.

original: gzung bar bya /🔽bklag par bya /🔽lung mnod par bya /
analyzed: gzung bar bya / bklag par bya / lung mnod par bya /
translated: They should hold it.🔽They should read it.

original: kha ton du bya /🔽tshig tu gdon par bya /
analyzed: kha ton du bya / tshig tu gdon par bya /
translated: They should receive it orally.🔽They should recite it.

original: kun chub par bya /
analyzed: kun chub par bya /
translated: They should proclaim it.🔽They should master it.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /🔽bsgom par bya ba nas me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya / bsgom par bya ba nas me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang /
translated: One should attend to it properly.

original: mar me la sogs pas ci nus ci phod du mchod pa'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pas ci nus ci phod du mchod pa'i bar du bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and with lamps and so on, to the best of one’s ability and strength.

original: rim gro bya'o //🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //

translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ma skyes ma 'gags pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is called the perfection of wisdom because it is unborn and unceasing.”

original: 'di ltar yang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / bya ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar gyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / bya ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar gyi phyir te /
translated: unoriginated, and so on, up to being non-existent.

original: gang dngos po med pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: That which is non-existent is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par shes par bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, for that reason, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should be known.

original: gang chos thams cad spyod yul ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad spyod yul ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te /
translated: That which is not the domain of all phenomena is the domain of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: 'di la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyod yul la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyod yul la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one practices in this way, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is said to have entered the domain.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: spyod yul ma yin pa theg pa thams cad pa 'di nyid spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa theg pa thams cad pa 'di nyid spyod yul yin no //
translated: This very non-domain of all vehicles is the domain.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyod yul 'di ni ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: spyod yul 'di ni ma byas pa ste /
translated: This domain is not created.

original: de'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it is called the non-domain.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang la spyad na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la spyad na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: when practicing what will bodhisattva mahāsattvas quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur @341a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur @341a *//
translated: “Mañjuśrī, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, bodhisattva mahāsattvas will quickly

original: du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, there is a samādhi called ‘single arrangement.’

original: ting nge 'dzin de la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po myur du bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice this samādhi, they will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī then said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar 'jug par bgyi /
analyzed: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar 'jug par bgyi /
translated: how do bodhisattva mahāsattvas enter the samādhi of the one who has a single mode of being?

original: ci'i slad du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the samādhi of the one who has a single mode of being?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, ‘single mode of being’ is a term for nonarising.”

original: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos thog ma nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dri ba bya dgos te /
analyzed: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos thog ma nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dri ba bya dgos te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to enter the samādhi of the single method should first ask questions about the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only then will they enter the samādhi of the single method.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'jam dpal / skye ba med pa ni mi 'khrugs pa ste /🔽dkrug tu mi rung ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / skye ba med pa ni mi 'khrugs pa ste / dkrug tu mi rung ba /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the unborn is unperturbed.🔽It is not to be disturbed.

original: dkrug par bya ba ma yin pa /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: dkrug par bya ba ma yin pa / bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: It is not to be agitated.🔽It is inconceivable.

original: bsam par mi bya ba /
analyzed: bsam par mi bya ba /
translated: It is not to be thought.

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba'o //
translated: It is beyond thought.

original: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa'i @341b ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos dben pa'i mal stan rnams bsten par bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa'i @341b ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos dben pa'i mal stan rnams bsten par bya /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to enter the samādhi of the single method should rely on a solitary bed and seat.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa la dga' bar byas la mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi bya bar skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa la dga' bar byas la mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi bya bar skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug nas /
translated: They should delight in solitude, not attending to any signs. They should sit cross-legged,

original: der mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig yid la bya'o //
analyzed: der mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig yid la bya'o //
translated: In that case, one should attend to the Tathāgata in a way that is not attended to.

original: chos thams cad kyang yid la bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang yid la bya'o //
translated: One should attend to all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yid la byed pa de'i ming yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yid la byed pa de'i ming yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should also take up the name of the Tathāgata to whom one is attending.

original: ming de yang thos te dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa de phyogs ga la bzhugs pa'i phyogs der mngon du bltas te 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: ming de yang thos te dmigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa de phyogs ga la bzhugs pa'i phyogs der mngon du bltas te 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Having heard that name and taken it up, one should sit facing the direction in which that Tathāgata resides.

original: yid la bya'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid yid la byas na /
analyzed: yid la bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid yid la byas na /
translated: One should attend to that.

original: de yid la byas pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yid la byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yid la byas pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yid la byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attending to that, one attends to the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathāgatas are one.

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa dang / spobs pa tshad med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa dang / spobs pa tshad med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Mañjuśrī, just as the qualities of a single Tathāgata are immeasurable and his eloquence is immeasurable,

original: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, having attained the one-purity meditative absorption,

original: skye ba med pa gcig gi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi bre brag tshad med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa gcig gi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi bre brag tshad med par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know the immeasurable distinctions of the Dharma discourse of the one unborn.

original: 'dir gang dag chud par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang dag gsungs pa dang / @342a *//
analyzed: 'dir gang dag chud par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gang dag gsungs pa dang / @342a *//
translated: Here, whatever is included, whatever has been taught by the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly awakened ones,

original: kun dga' bos ji snyed yongs su bzung ba de snyed kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun dga' bos ji snyed yongs su bzung ba de snyed kyi chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and whatever has been fully taken up by Ānanda, that much of this Dharma discourse will appear.

original: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrubs pas de'i tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa de tsam du gnas shing /
analyzed: bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bsgrubs pas de'i tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa de tsam du gnas shing /
translated: By accomplishing this one-purity meditative absorption, one will abide for as long as one's lifespan.

original: gling bzhi dang bcas pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gling bzhi dang bcas pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will teach the Dharma together with the four continents.

original: 'jam dpal / de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa kha cig 'di snyam du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di gang yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa kha cig 'di snyam du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di gang yin snyam du sems na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle think, 'What is this one-purity meditative absorption?'

original: de dag la 'di skad ces yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsgrags pa 'di yang dag par gzung la 'dug cig dang / ji lta ji ltar yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsgrags pa 'di yang dag par gzung la 'dug cig dang / ji lta ji ltar yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: As you take it up and hold it, you will see the qualities of this absorption.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhum pa med par gyis shig /🔽ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis zhum pa med par gyis shig / ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Do not be discouraged, as I have taught.’

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni dmigs pa'i lta ba can dag dang / dngos por lta ba can dag nas yod par lta ba can dag gi bar gyis bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni dmigs pa'i lta ba can dag dang / dngos por lta ba can dag nas yod par lta ba can dag gi bar gyis bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: This absorption cannot be accomplished by those who have a view of reference points, by those who have a view of entities, and so forth, up to by those who have a view of existence.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi zhig la rin thang med pa'i nor bu rin po che byi dor ma byas pa zhig bdog la /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig la rin thang med pa'i nor bu rin po che byi dor ma byas pa zhig bdog la /
translated: Suppose a person has an unpolished precious gem of inestimable value.

original: mi gzhan zhig gis der mi de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: mi gzhan zhig gis der mi de la 'di skad du /
translated: Another person says to him,

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: ‘Hey, person!

original: nor bu rin po che 'di'i rin thang ci tsam /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di'i rin thang ci tsam /
translated: What is the value of this precious gem?’

original: nor bu rin po che 'di la yon tan ci zhig yod ces zer la /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di la yon tan ci zhig yod ces zer la /
translated: “What are the qualities of this precious jewel?”

original: mi des kyang de la 'di skad du /
analyzed: mi des kyang de la 'di skad du /
translated: The first man replies,

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: “Oh, man!

original: nor bu rin po che 'di'i yon tan tshad med kyi /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di'i yon tan tshad med kyi /
translated: The qualities of this precious jewel are immeasurable.

original: tshad @342b med pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces smras te /
analyzed: tshad @342b med pa nyid du shes par gyis shig ces smras te /
translated: You should know that they are immeasurable.”

original: de nas mi des nor bu rin po che de byi dor bya ba'i phyir mi de la bzhag nas /
analyzed: de nas mi des nor bu rin po che de byi dor bya ba'i phyir mi de la bzhag nas /
translated: Then the first man leaves the precious jewel with the second man in order to have it cleaned.

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: “Oh, man!

original: nor bu rin po che 'di re zhig byi dor gyis shig dang / de nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes byas la /🔽de nas mi des nor bu rin po che de mi de las blangs te /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di re zhig byi dor gyis shig dang / de nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes byas la / de nas mi des nor bu rin po che de mi de las blangs te /
translated: Clean this precious jewel for a while and then you will know it.”🔽Then the first man takes the precious jewel from the second man and has it cleaned with the cleaning materials.

original: phyi bdar bya ba'i yo byad rnams kyis byi dor byas pa dang / de ltar byi dor byas pas nor bu rin po che de ring thang med de /
analyzed: phyi bdar bya ba'i yo byad rnams kyis byi dor byas pa dang / de ltar byi dor byas pas nor bu rin po che de ring thang med de /
translated: But when it is cleaned, the precious jewel is not worth much.

original: des ji lta ji ltar nor bu rin po che de'i phyi bdar byas pa de lta de ltar nor bu rin po che de'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: des ji lta ji ltar nor bu rin po che de'i phyi bdar byas pa de lta de ltar nor bu rin po che de'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the more he polishes the precious jewel, the more he sees the qualities of the precious jewel,

original: 'jam dpal / gang dang gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ting nge 'dzin 'di la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / 'jug pa de dang / de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang dang gang gi tshe rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ting nge 'dzin 'di la mnyam par 'jog pa dang / 'jug pa de dang / de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yon tan mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, Mañjuśrī, whenever a son or daughter of good family enters into and rests in evenness in this meditative absorption, at that time they see the qualities of this meditative absorption.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer dag gis sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' gang yang ma khyab pa med do //
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer dag gis sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' gang yang ma khyab pa med do //
translated: there is no place on the surface of the earth that is not reached by the light rays of the orb of the sun.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob cing zhugs nas rnyed pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i chos gang yang mi ston to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob cing zhugs nas rnyed pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i chos gang yang mi ston to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, having attained and entered this meditative absorption of a single array, there is no Dharma that is not taught by the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang la las 'di bzhin du shes nas skye ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang la las 'di bzhin du shes nas skye ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos gang yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Whoever knows this will not see any phenomena that contradict the absence of arising.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po'i phyogs bzhi nas skyes bu bzhi chu 'chu na /🔽de thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na / rgya mtsho chen po'i phyogs bzhi nas skyes bu bzhi chu 'chu na / de thams cad 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, if four people were to draw water from the four directions of the great ocean,

original: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig /
analyzed: lan tshva'i ror ro gcig /
translated: all of it would be taken as a single taste,

original: @343a *// pa nyid du chu zhing len to //
analyzed: @343a *// pa nyid du chu zhing len to //
translated: namely, the taste of salt.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du ngas chos gang ci bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du ngas chos gang ci bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, whatever Dharma I teach, all of it is of a single taste,

original: skye ba med pa'i ro dang / dngos pa med pa'i ro dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ro dang / rnam par grol ba'i ro dang / 'gog pa'i ror ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i ro dang / dngos pa med pa'i ro dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ro dang / rnam par grol ba'i ro dang / 'gog pa'i ror ro gcig pa'o //
translated: namely, the taste of non-arising, the taste of non-existence, the taste of freedom from desire, the taste of liberation, and the taste of cessation.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ting nge 'dzin 'di dang ldan pa de chos gang dang gang ston kyang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ting nge 'dzin 'di dang ldan pa de chos gang dang gang ston kyang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, therefore, whatever Dharma a son or daughter of noble family endowed with this samādhi teaches,

original: de dag thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'di lta ste /
translated: all of it is of a single taste,🔽namely, the taste of non-arising, the taste of non-existence, the taste of freedom from desire, the taste of liberation, and the taste of cessation.

original: skye ba med ba'i ro dang / dngos po med pa'i ro dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ro dang / rnam par grol ba'i ro dang / 'gog pa'i ror ro gcig par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med ba'i ro dang / dngos po med pa'i ro dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ro dang / rnam par grol ba'i ro dang / 'gog pa'i ror ro gcig par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: the taste of non-arising, the taste of non-entity, the taste of freedom from desire, the taste of liberation, and the taste of cessation.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di thob nas rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de 'dod na /

analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /

translated: Son of noble family, those who do not think about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and do not conceptualize it have this kind of patience, which leads to the attainment of the bodhisattvas’ qualities and the buddhas’ qualities.🔽Son of noble family, I explain that this kind of patience, which does not aspire to awakening for the sake of buddhahood itself, is the swift path to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: dang mi 'bral bar brjod par bya'o //

translated: Today,
