analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang gtam ci zhig byas zhes 'dri na /
translated: if asked, ‘What did you discuss with the Blessed One?’

original: de la bdag gis 'di skad du gal te khyod de nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid la ma gtod /
analyzed: de la bdag gis 'di skad du gal te khyod de nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid la ma gtod /
translated: I would say to him, ‘If you wish to hear it, listen with a mind that does not focus on anything,

original: cig / mnyan to snyam du sems ma bskyed cig /
analyzed: cig / mnyan to snyam du sems ma bskyed cig /
translated: and do not generate the thought, “I will listen.”

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: O man,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i shes rab skyed cig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di shes par nus so; ;kye skyes bu /🔽gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i shes rab skyed cig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di shes par nus so; ;kye skyes bu / gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Generate the wisdom that is like the wisdom of an illusory person, and through that you will be able to understand this Dharma teaching.🔽“O being, if you wish to listen to this Dharma teaching, then you should be like a bird in the sky.

original: dper na / nam mkha' la bya'i rjes lta bur gnas par gyis shig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par nus so //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la bya'i rjes lta bur gnas par gyis shig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par nus so //
translated: Through that you will be able to listen to this Dharma teaching.”

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: “O being,

original: gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir gnyis pa la ma dmigs shig /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir gnyis pa la ma dmigs shig /
translated: if you wish to listen to this Dharma teaching, then do not focus on duality.

original: mi gnyis pa la'ang ma dmigs shig /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa la'ang ma dmigs shig /
translated: Do not focus on nonduality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi gnyis par brjod par bya ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnyis par brjod par bya ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever to be expressed as dual or nondual.

original: gal te chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma gzhig cig /
analyzed: gal te chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma gzhig cig /
translated: If you wish to listen to this Dharma teaching, do not destroy the perception of a self.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams las kyang ma 'da' zhig /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams las kyang ma 'da' zhig /
translated: Do not go beyond the views.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang lhag bar ma dmigs shig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang lhag bar ma dmigs shig /
translated: Do not take the qualities of a buddha to be special.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma bskyod cig ces brjod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma bskyod cig ces brjod par bgyi'o //
translated: Do not move from the qualities of an ordinary person.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang zhig bdag las nyan par 'tshal te /🔽'di na de la bdag gis @346b de skad brjod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag las nyan par 'tshal te / 'di na de la bdag gis @346b de skad brjod par bgyi'o //
translated: if someone wants to listen to me,🔽I will say this to them.

original: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will teach them this.

original: de ltar 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: I will establish them in this.

original: gal te 'dri ba'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing /
analyzed: gal te 'dri ba'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing /
translated: If that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who is asking questions stays like this,

original: de ltar zhugs na spobs pa'i phyag rgya 'di la gnas pa de la slad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar 'di bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs na spobs pa'i phyag rgya 'di la gnas pa de la slad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar 'di bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: if they practice like this, then later I will teach them this seal of eloquence, this non-arising of the perfection of wisdom, up to this non-existence of things and non-production.’

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽'jam dpal / legs so //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // 'jam dpal / legs so //
translated: When he had thus spoken, the Lord said to the youthful Manjushri:🔽“Excellent, Manjushri, excellent!

original: legs so // 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di legs par smras pa legs so //
analyzed: legs so // 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di legs par smras pa legs so //
translated: Manjushri, you have spoken well.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad ces gyis shig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad ces gyis shig /
translated: And you should also say to that son of a good family or daughter of a good family:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: ‘If you want to see the Tathagata, you should meditate on this perfection of wisdom itself by way of not meditating.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: And a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who wants to serve the Tathagata should train in this perfection of wisdom itself by way of not apprehending anything.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes smra bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par @347a *//🔽rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes smra bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o // bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par @347a *// rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who want to say, ‘The Tathāgata is my teacher,’ should train in just this perfection of wisdom, in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.🔽“Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should train in just this perfection of wisdom, in the manner of not settling down on anything.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas par bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas par bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who want to accomplish expertise in all meditative stabilizations should train in just this perfection of wisdom, in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Also, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to enter into all meditative stabilizations should train in just this perfection of wisdom, without taking anything as a basis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those meditative stabilizations are not made.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Also, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who wants to accomplish the knowledge of a knower of all aspects endowed with all aspects should train in just this perfection of wisdom, by way of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du byas pa ma yin pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du byas pa ma yin pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the knowledge of a knower of all aspects endowed with all aspects is not made, is not born, and does not exist.”

original: chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are definitely released.🔽There is no phenomenon that is not definitely released.

original: gang nges par mi 'byung ba dang bcas pa yang med do zhes de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi @347b pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gang nges par mi 'byung ba dang bcas pa yang med do zhes de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi @347b pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: In this way, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to understand should train in the perfection of wisdom, up to the absence of being, of non-being, and of both being and non-being.

original: chos thams cad ni nges par mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nges par mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are definitely not released.

original: gang nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos de gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos de gang yang med do //
translated: There is no phenomenon that is definitely released.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are unborn.

original: chos de dag ni ji ltar brjod pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos de dag ni ji ltar brjod pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those phenomena do not exist as they are described.

original: brjod du med pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med do zhes de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med do zhes de ltar shes par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o
translated: “The son of a good family or daughter of a good family who wants to know that ‘the inexpressible is not existent and is not apprehended’ should train in this perfection of wisdom, up to the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: // sems can thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
analyzed: // sems can thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
translated: “All sentient beings are practicing for awakening.

original: gang byang chub kyi phyir mi spyod pa'i sems can de gang yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi phyir mi spyod pa'i sems can de gang yang med do zhe na /
translated: There is not a single sentient being who is not practicing for awakening.”

original: yang de la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: “The son of a good family or daughter of a good family who wants to know that without being disheartened should train in this perfection of wisdom, up to the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are the same as awakening.”

original: ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa dang / byang chub ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa dang / byang chub ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is awakening, so are all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad ci 'dra bar spyod pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ci 'dra bar spyod pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as are all sentient beings, so is their conduct.

original: med pa'i phyir spyod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa'o; ;de yang byang chub ste /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir spyod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa'o; ;de yang byang chub ste /
translated: Because of non-existence, all conduct is non-conduct.🔽And that is awakening.

original: byang chub gang yin pa skye ba med pa'ang de yin /
analyzed: byang chub gang yin pa skye ba med pa'ang de yin /
translated: That which is awakening is also non-arising.

original: 'byung ba med pa'ang de yin te /🔽de lta bu'i chos 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu @348a *//
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa'ang de yin te / de lta bu'i chos 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu @348a *//
translated: It is also non-occurrence.🔽A son of good family or a daughter of good family who, without being disheartened by this kind of Dharma, wishes to train in this perfection of wisdom,

original: mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in it by way of non-entity, up to non-arising.

original: zhes gyis shig /
analyzed: zhes gyis shig /
translated: You should say:

original: 'jam dpal / gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa'i bar de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las bstan to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa'i bar de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las bstan to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, all the magical displays of the Tathāgata, up to and including the Tathāgata’s play, are taught in this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni bstan du med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bstan du med pa ste /
translated: It is because it cannot be taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽'jam dpal / dge slong ngam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi ston pa'i phyir ro // 'jam dpal / dge slong ngam /
translated: It is because the perfection of wisdom does not teach.

original: dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, I say that any monk,🔽nun,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: layman,🔽or laywoman who, from this perfection of wisdom, even just memorizes a four-line stanza, masters it,

original: dge bsnyen ma gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang // 'chang ba dang / klog pa nas yang dag par ston pa'i bar du byed pa de dag kyang phyir mi ldog bar nga 'chad na /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang // 'chang ba dang / klog pa nas yang dag par ston pa'i bar du byed pa de dag kyang phyir mi ldog bar nga 'chad na /
translated: carries it, reads it aloud, and teaches it correctly, will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang dag de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin nyid du bsgrub pa lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who practice in accordance with reality?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu nges par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu nges par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family should be known to be certain of awakening.

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa'i bar 'di thos nas mi skrag /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa'i bar 'di thos nas mi skrag /
translated: Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, which is deep, not born, and up to not arisen, not ceased, not defiled, not purified, not decreased, and not increased, are not afraid,

original: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi yul la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi yul la gnas pa'o //
translated: are not terrified, and do not become terrified, they stand in the domain of the Buddha.

original: gong du yang mos par byed na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong du yang mos par byed na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they also have superior aspiration, they will be certain of all the buddhadharmas.

original: 'jam dpal / ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mkhyen pa dgra @348b bcom pa thams cad kyis yang dag pa mnos pa'i rgya 'di bzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mkhyen pa dgra @348b bcom pa thams cad kyis yang dag pa mnos pa'i rgya 'di bzhag par bya ste /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, I will set out this seal that is approved by the Buddha, that is known by the Tathāgata, and that is fully taken up by all the worthy ones.

original: rgya 'di ni mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams la bzhag go /
analyzed: rgya 'di ni mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams la bzhag go /
translated: This seal is set out for those who have realized sameness.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yang chags pa med pa yongs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi bar du yang chags pa med pa yongs su ston pa'o //
translated: This shows up to the absence of attachment to all the buddhadharmas.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo rgya 'dis btab pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i skal pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo rgya 'dis btab pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i skal pa can ma yin no //
translated: Manjusri, the sons and daughters of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who are sealed with this seal are not destined to go to the lower realms.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro ba'am 'jug pa'i skal ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'gro ba'am 'jug pa'i skal ba can ma yin no //
translated: They are not destined to go to the level of the Sravakas or Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de nas de'i tshe lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyis lha'i tsan dan gyi phye ma dang / lha'i gser gyi phye ma dang / lha'i me tog manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po dang /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyis lha'i tsan dan gyi phye ma dang / lha'i gser gyi phye ma dang / lha'i me tog manda ra ba dang / manda ra ba chen po dang /
translated: Then at that time Sakra, Chief of Gods, and the Thirty-Three Gods scattered divine sandal-wood powder, divine gold powder, divine Mandarava flowers, and great Mandarava flowers,

original: lha'i spos dang / lha'i autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar po dang / lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang mchod cing bcom ldan 'das dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la yang gtor to //
analyzed: lha'i spos dang / lha'i autpa la dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar po dang / lha'i rol mo'i sgra dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang mchod cing bcom ldan 'das dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la yang gtor to //
translated: divine incense, divine utpala, kumuda, and white lotus flowers, and divine music, and worshipped this perfection of wisdom and also scattered them over the Lord and the youthful Manjusri.

original: mngon par gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang dag phyag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi bla na med pa'i chos rin po che 'di mchod pa dang / phyi phyir zhing thos par gyur cig ces smras so //
analyzed: mngon par gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis gang dag phyag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi bla na med pa'i chos rin po che 'di mchod pa dang / phyi phyir zhing thos par gyur cig ces smras so //
translated: Having scattered them, he said these words: “By this root of merit, may those who are sealed by this seal worship this unsurpassed jewel of the Dharma and hear it again and again.”

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang tshig 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang tshig 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, also said these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag gis kyang ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa'i bar 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir spyod par 'gyur ba dang / rigs kyi bu dang rigs @349a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdag gis kyang ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa'i bar 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir spyod par 'gyur ba dang / rigs kyi bu dang rigs @349a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: kyi bu mos de 'dra ba de dag gi rna lam du grags par 'gyur ba nas de dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bsgrub par 'gyur bar bgyi ba'i bar gyi slad du brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: kyi bu mos de 'dra ba de dag gi rna lam du grags par 'gyur ba nas de dag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bsgrub par 'gyur bar bgyi ba'i bar gyi slad du brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: I too will strive to ensure that this non-arising and non-production of the profound perfection of wisdom will be practiced in this world, and that sons and daughters of good family will hear it, up to the point where they will accomplish all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du tshegs chung ngus grags la /🔽thos nas kyang mos pa dang / mos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / 'chang ba'i bar du bgyis pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis bdag cag gi 'di ni lhas bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang gi rna lam du tshegs chung ngus grags la / thos nas kyang mos pa dang / mos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / 'chang ba'i bar du bgyis pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis bdag cag gi 'di ni lhas bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: “If any son or daughter of good family hears this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, and if they believe it with little difficulty,

original: zhes the tshom ma mchis par 'tshal bar bgyi'o //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes the tshom ma mchis par 'tshal bar bgyi'o // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and if, having believed it, they take it up, master it, keep it, and so on, those sons or daughters of good family should know without doubt that this is accomplished by the gods.🔽”

original: ko'u shi ka /
analyzed: ko'u shi ka /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “So it is, Kauśika!

original: de de bzhin no; ;rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub par blta'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no; ;rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub par blta'o //
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family should be seen as having accomplished all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang nges par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang nges par shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as certain to reach unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: please bless this teaching of the perfection of wisdom for the sake of those sons of noble family or daughters of noble family.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: please bless it.

original: tshig 'di skad smras ma thag tu de'i tshe skad cig de nyid la sangs rgyas kyi @349b mthus sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: tshig 'di skad smras ma thag tu de'i tshe skad cig de nyid la sangs rgyas kyi @349b mthus sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: As soon as he had spoken these words, at that very moment, through the Buddha’s power, the great earth shook in six ways.

original: sa chen po g-yos ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: sa chen po g-yos ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: As soon as the great earth shook, at that time the Blessed One smiled.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa byin gyis rlob pa na /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One smiled, at that time, when the Thus-Gone One blessed this teaching of the perfection of wisdom,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas lags so //
translated: this is a sign that the Thus-Gone One will bless this teaching of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is so!

original: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas rnams te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas rnams te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these are signs that the Thus-Gone One will bless this teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ltas 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa shes pa bya'o //
analyzed: ltas 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa shes pa bya'o //
translated: Through these signs, you should know that this teaching of the perfection of wisdom will be blessed.

original: 'jam dpal / gang dag chos gang yang mi spong zhing mi bzlog la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang dag chos gang yang mi spong zhing mi bzlog la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, those who do not reject or oppose any phenomenon

analyzed: bsngags par yang mi byed pa de dang de dag ni phyag rgya 'dis btab par shes par bya'o //
translated: Those who do not praise it should be known to be sealed with this seal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / dmigs pa yod na spong bar byed pa dang / bsngags par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dmigs pa yod na spong bar byed pa dang / bsngags par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is because those who have an object of reference will reject it and praise it.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na gang dag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi ched du ngas rgya 'di bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na gang dag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi ched du ngas rgya 'di bzhag ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, therefore, I have set forth this seal for those who are sealed with this seal.

original: @350a *// 'di ltar de dag gis thos nas kyang chos gang la yang ston pa'am /
analyzed: @350a *// 'di ltar de dag gis thos nas kyang chos gang la yang ston pa'am /
translated: In this way, having heard it, they will not teach any dharma

original: rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: and will not conceptualize it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is because ultimately all dharmas are unborn.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus, the youthful Mañjuśrī, those bodhisattva great beings, those great hearers, and the gods, humans, demigods, and gandharvas all rejoiced and praised the teachings of the Blessed One.

original: dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: The world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in what the Bhagavān had said.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //🔽'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya ba las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do // 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya ba las /
translated: They praised what the Bhagavān had said.

original: 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa'i le'u shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa'i le'u shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This was the chapter on Mañjuśrī’s questions, the seventh hundred of the Dharma teaching of the Great Heap of Jewels in one hundred thousand chapters.🔽The forty-sixth assembly is complete.
